text: I have a 3x76 Array{Any,2}. Row1 is string, rest are float64. How can I sort it according to ascending order of row2?

elements.text: I have a 3x76 Array{Any,2}. Row1 is string, rest are float64. How can I sort it according to ascending order of row2?

text: Using `sort!`  function, all rows are being shorted in ascending order. I don't want this. I want to sort row2 in ascending order and row1 and row3 according to row2. Please suggest some ways to do so. Thanks

elements.text: function, all rows are being shorted in ascending order. I don't want this. I want to sort row2 in ascending order and row1 and row3 according to row2. Please suggest some ways to do so. Thanks

text: Something like `sort(xs; by=x->x[2], dims=2)`

Aside: it doesn't matter for small cases like this, but if you are scaling this up: and array of mixed ytypes isn't very performant.
Better would be to use a DataFrame or a TypedTable etc

ah my bad for a multidimensional array apparently it is is `sortslices`
`sortslices(xs; dims=2, by=x->x[2]`)

(No inplace form)
